labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed for browser automation, allowing users to run, monitor, manage, and interact with automated browser tasks. It provides tools for starting, stopping, pausing, resuming, and checking the status of tasks, as well as retrieving detailed information about each task. Additionally, it includes functionality to check account balance and available credits, indicating an emphasis on managing automation resources efficiently.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality is clearly around browser automation, which aligns with the "Browser Automation" category. Secondary labels like "Web Search & Research" and "API Integration" are relevant because browser automation often involves web interactions and API calls for task management. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Browser Use Automation Server
server_info_crawled.author: @mhazarabad/browser-use-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Automate browser tasks seamlessly using the Browser Use API. Run, monitor, pause, resume, and manage browser automation tasks with ease. Check your account balance and retrieve detailed task information to streamline your workflows.

tools.name: run task
tools.description: Deploy Server Browser Use Automation Server @mhazarabad/browser-use-mcp Try in Playground

tools.name: get task
tools.description: Retrieve details of a browser automation task by its ID, including steps and output.

tools.name: get task status
tools.description: Check the current status of a browser automation task without retrieving full details.

tools.name: stop task
tools.description: Stop a running browser automation task. A stopped task cannot be resumed.

tools.name: pause task
tools.description: Pause a running browser automation task so it can be resumed later using the resume_task tool.

tools.name: resume task
tools.description: Resume a previously paused browser automation task to continue execution from where it left off.

tools.name: list tasks
tools.description: List all browser automation tasks in your account with their current status. Use get_task to retrieve full details for a specific task.

tools.name: check_balance
tools.description: Check your Browser Use account balance, usage limits, and available credits.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mhazarabad/browser-use-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
